title: Will Massachusetts pass an economic development bill by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the Massachusetts Legislature passes an economic development bill by August 31, 2024. The bill must be formally approved by both chambers of the legislature and signed into law by the governor. An 'economic development bill' is defined as legislation primarily focused on stimulating economic growth, job creation, or business development in the state. The bill must be explicitly labeled or widely recognized as an economic development initiative. If no such bill is passed and signed into law by the specified date, or if a bill is passed but does not meet the criteria of an economic development bill, the question resolves as NO.

article_information.article_description: The Massachusetts Legislature has ended its 19-month formal session. Lawmakers approved a housing bond bill but left other major proposals in limbo including an economic development bill, a renewable energy bill and a hospital bill. With Thursday's close, the…

title: Will Massachusetts enact a renewable energy bill by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the Massachusetts Legislature passes a renewable energy bill and it is signed into law by the governor by August 31, 2024. The bill must specifically address renewable energy policies or initiatives, such as setting new renewable energy targets, providing incentives for clean energy adoption, or establishing new regulations for the renewable energy sector. The bill must be reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such bill is enacted by the specified date, or if a bill is passed but does not substantially address renewable energy policies, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Massachusetts approve a major hospital-related bill by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the Massachusetts Legislature passes a significant hospital-related bill and it is signed into law by the governor by August 31, 2024. To qualify, the bill must primarily focus on hospital policies, regulations, or funding, and be considered a major piece of legislation by local news outlets. Examples of qualifying bills could include those addressing hospital funding, healthcare worker regulations, or significant changes to hospital operations. The bill must be new legislation, not a continuation or minor amendment of existing laws. If no such bill is approved by the specified date, or if only minor hospital-related amendments are passed as part of other legislation, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Massachusetts hold an unscheduled formal legislative session before August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the Massachusetts Legislature convenes for an unscheduled formal session before August 1, 2024. An unscheduled formal session is defined as an official meeting of the legislature outside of its regular 19-month formal session, where bills can be debated and voted upon. This does not include regularly scheduled formal sessions that are part of the normal legislative calendar. If no such unscheduled formal session occurs by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Intel announce the completion of a major workforce reduction by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Intel has officially announced the completion of a significant workforce reduction of at least 10% of its total employees. The announcement must come from an official Intel source, such as a press release, financial report, or statement from a company executive. The actual number of job cuts should be explicitly stated or easily calculable from the information provided. If Intel does not announce the completion of such a workforce reduction by the resolution date, or if the announced reduction is less than 10% of its total workforce, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question is not tied to any specific previously announced layoff plans.

title: Will Intel's stock price outperform Nvidia's by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Intel's stock price percentage change from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024, exceeds that of Nvidia's over the same period. The comparison will be based on the closing prices on these dates (or the last trading day before if the date falls on a weekend or holiday). The percentage change will be calculated as (Final Price - Initial Price) / Initial Price * 100. If Intel's percentage change is greater than Nvidia's, even by a small margin, the question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO. In case of any stock splits or similar corporate actions, the prices will be adjusted accordingly to ensure a fair comparison.

title: Will Intel announce a new major strategic partnership by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Intel publicly announces a new major strategic partnership with another company or organization. A 'major strategic partnership' is defined as a collaboration that involves significant joint development, manufacturing, or marketing efforts, and is explicitly described as strategic by Intel in its official communications. The partnership must be new and not a renewal or extension of an existing agreement. The announcement must be made through official Intel channels such as press releases, SEC filings, or statements from C-level executives. If no such partnership is announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Jimmy Carter attend a public event celebrating his 100th birthday by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is credible reporting from at least two reputable news sources confirming that Jimmy Carter personally attended a public event celebrating his 100th birthday. The event must be officially organized to honor Carter's centennial and be open to media coverage. If Carter does not attend any such event due to health reasons or any other circumstances, or if no such event takes place by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. The attendance must be in person, not virtual.

title: Will India finalize a significant loan to Vietnam for maritime security by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, India and Vietnam officially sign an agreement for a loan of at least $250 million specifically aimed at enhancing Vietnam's maritime security. The agreement must be confirmed by official statements from either the Indian or Vietnamese government, or reported by at least two reputable international news agencies. The loan amount should be substantial (at least $250 million) and explicitly stated to be for maritime security purposes. If no such agreement is signed or officially announced by the resolution date, or if the loan is for a significantly smaller amount or different purpose, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will India-Vietnam trade volume increase by at least 50% by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the bilateral trade volume between India and Vietnam increases by at least 50% compared to its most recently reported value as of October 1, 2023, by July 31, 2024. The trade volume increase must be verified by official government statistics from either country or reputable international trade organizations. If the trade volume does not increase by at least 50% or if there's insufficient data to confirm the increase by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a major Indian company announce a significant investment in Vietnam by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a major Indian company (defined as a company listed on the National Stock Exchange of India with a market capitalization of over $1 billion) announces a significant investment (defined as over $50 million) in Vietnam. The announcement must be made through official company channels or reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a major production company announce a Nüshu-themed movie or TV series by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a major film or television production company officially announces the development of a movie or TV series centered around the Nüshu script or its cultural significance. A 'major production company' is defined as one that has produced at least three internationally distributed films or TV series in the past five years. The production must specifically focus on Nüshu as a central theme, not merely feature it as a minor plot element. The announcement must be verifiable through official company statements or widely reported in mainstream media. If no such announcement meeting these criteria is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a Nüshu language course be offered by a top 100 global university by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one university ranked in the top 100 of the QS World University Rankings announces or begins offering a course specifically dedicated to teaching the Nüshu script. The course must be part of the official curriculum, either as a full semester course or a shorter intensive program. Online courses qualify if they are officially sanctioned by the university. The question resolves as NO if no such course is offered or announced by the specified date, or if the courses offered do not meet these criteria.

title: Will a Nüshu-related product be launched by a Fortune 500 company by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a company listed in the Fortune 500 launches a product or product line that prominently features or is inspired by the Nüshu script. This could include, but is not limited to, fashion items, stationery, digital fonts, or home decor. The product must be commercially available and the Nüshu connection must be explicitly mentioned in the official product description or marketing materials. The question resolves as NO if no such product is launched by the specified date, or if the products do not meet these criteria.

title: Will the Virginia-based political marketing company face additional legal action in New Hampshire by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the New Hampshire Attorney General's office or any other state legal authority announces further legal action against the Virginia-based political marketing company that was fined $40,000 for flyers designed during the 2022 New Hampshire state primary. This could include additional fines, lawsuits, or criminal charges related to their political marketing activities in New Hampshire. The legal action must be new and separate from the $40,000 fine already imposed. If no such additional legal action is announced by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will New Hampshire implement stricter regulations on political marketing companies by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the New Hampshire state legislature passes and the governor signs into law new regulations specifically targeting political marketing companies and their activities during elections. These regulations must be more stringent than those in place as of October 1, 2023, and must directly address issues such as transparency in political advertising or penalties for violations. The new regulations must be explicitly aimed at political marketing companies, not just general campaign finance laws. If no such new regulations are enacted by the specified date, or if the regulations passed do not meet these criteria, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a book or documentary about James 'Whitey' Bulger's prison death be released by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a book or documentary specifically focusing on the circumstances of James 'Whitey' Bulger's 2018 prison death is released. The work must be publicly available and verified by at least two reputable news sources. To qualify, the book or documentary must dedicate a substantial portion (at least 50%) of its content to Bulger's prison death and the events surrounding it. Self-published works or unofficial online videos do not count. If no such book or documentary meeting these criteria is released by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the prison where James 'Whitey' Bulger died implement new safety measures by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Penitentiary Hazelton in West Virginia, where James 'Whitey' Bulger was killed in 2018, announces or implements new safety measures that can be reasonably linked to preventing similar incidents. The measures must be officially announced by the prison administration, the Federal Bureau of Prisons, or the Department of Justice and reported by at least two reputable news sources. Examples of such measures could include changes in inmate transfer protocols, increased surveillance, or improved staff training. If no such measures are announced or implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. Note that routine updates or changes not specifically aimed at preventing incidents similar to Bulger's death will not qualify for a YES resolution.

title: Will a book be published by a journalist about their detention in a foreign country by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a book (in any format, including e-book) is published by a journalist detailing their experiences during detention in a foreign country. The book must be officially released by a recognized publishing house or self-published through major platforms like Amazon. The publication must be verifiable through book listings, author announcements, or credible media reports from at least two reputable news organizations. The journalist must have been detained for at least one month in a country other than their home country, and the book must primarily focus on their detention experience. If no such book is published or officially announced with a release date by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the U.S. Department of Labor reports that initial jobless claims for any week up to and including the last full week of August 2024 exceed 300,000. The resolution will be based on the official, seasonally adjusted figures released by the U.S. Department of Labor. If no such week occurs, or if the reporting system significantly changes, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the U.S. unemployment rate surpass 4% by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports a national unemployment rate above 4.0% for any month up to and including August 2024. The resolution will be based on the official, seasonally adjusted U-3 unemployment rate. If the rate remains at or below 4.0% for all months through August 2024, or if the reporting methodology significantly changes, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a U.S. recession be officially declared by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if the National Bureau of Economic Research (NBER) declares that the U.S. economy has entered a recession at any point up to and including August 31, 2024. The NBER is the official arbiter of U.S. recessions. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, or if the NBER's role in determining recessions changes significantly, the question resolves as NO. Note that the NBER typically declares recessions with a significant lag, sometimes months or even a year after they have begun.

title: Will the U.S. DOT implement a rule banning airlines from charging for family seating by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) officially implements a rule that prohibits airlines from charging additional fees for parents to sit with their children aged 13 or younger on flights. The rule must be formally adopted and scheduled for implementation, not just proposed. For a YES resolution, the rule must: 1. Be officially announced by the DOT as implemented or scheduled for implementation. 2. Specifically prohibit airlines from charging extra fees for family seating arrangements for children 13 and under. 3. Apply to both U.S. and foreign carriers operating in the United States. The question will resolve as NO if: 1. No such rule is implemented or scheduled for implementation by August 31, 2024. 2. A rule is implemented but does not meet all the criteria mentioned above. Resolution will be based on official announcements from the U.S. Department of Transportation or at least two reputable news sources reporting on the implementation of such a rule.

title: Will a major U.S. airline voluntarily adopt a policy to seat children 13 or younger next to an accompanying adult at no extra charge by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one of the top 5 U.S. airlines by passenger volume (as of 2023) voluntarily implements a policy to seat children 13 or younger next to an accompanying adult without additional fees, regardless of whether the proposed DOT rule is implemented. The policy must be officially announced and implemented by the airline. Resolution will be based on official airline announcements or reputable news sources reporting on such policy changes.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) implements a new federal regulation that requires airlines to seat children aged 13 or younger next to an accompanying adult without charging additional fees. The regulation must be officially enacted and published in the Federal Register. It resolves as NO if such a regulation is not implemented by the specified date, or if the DOT withdraws the proposal entirely. The resolution will be based on official DOT announcements or reputable news sources reporting on the implementation of the regulation.

title: Will Nigeria experience nationwide protests against economic conditions involving over 100,000 participants by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria experiences nationwide protests against economic conditions that involve more than 100,000 participants across multiple cities. The protests must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, BBC, Al Jazeera). The protests should be primarily focused on economic issues such as inflation, cost of living, or government economic policies. This question will resolve as NO if such protests do not occur or if the reported number of participants does not exceed 100,000 across the country. Note that this question is specifically about future protests on a larger scale than those that have occurred previously.

title: Will the Nigerian government implement a new economic reform package by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Nigerian federal government announces and begins implementing a new comprehensive economic reform package. The reform package must include measures addressing at least three of the following areas: inflation control, job creation, subsidy reforms, or currency stabilization. The implementation of the package must be reported by at least two major Nigerian news outlets and one international news agency. If no such reform package is announced and implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Nigeria's annual inflation rate exceed 30% by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if Nigeria's official annual inflation rate, as reported by the National Bureau of Statistics of Nigeria or a reputable international financial institution (such as the IMF or World Bank), exceeds 30% at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The inflation rate must be reported for the overall economy, not just for specific sectors. If the inflation rate remains at or below 30% throughout this period, or if no reliable data is available, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the US Senate pass a bipartisan tax cut package expanding the child tax credit by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bipartisan tax cut package that includes an expansion of the child tax credit. To qualify:

1. The package must be approved by a majority vote in the Senate.
2. It must explicitly include provisions to expand the child tax credit for families.
3. The package must be considered 'bipartisan,' meaning it receives support from both major political parties.

The question will resolve as NO if:
- Such a package is not passed by August 31, 2024.
- A passed package does not include the child tax credit expansion.
- The passed package is not considered bipartisan.

Note: The mere introduction or discussion of such a package is not sufficient for a YES resolution. The package must be officially passed by the Senate.

title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a major bipartisan tax cut package by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Senate passes a major bipartisan tax cut package that includes both an expansion of the child tax credit and restoration of certain business tax breaks. To be considered 'major', the package must have a total estimated value of at least $50 billion over 10 years, as reported by the Congressional Budget Office or Joint Committee on Taxation. 'Bipartisan' means the bill must receive at least 5 votes from senators of the minority party. The package must be passed as a standalone bill or as part of larger legislation. If no such package is passed by the Senate by July 31, 2024, or if a package is passed but does not meet the criteria specified, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the US Senate hold a floor vote on a bipartisan tax cut package including child tax credit expansion by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the US Senate holds a floor vote on a bipartisan tax cut package that includes provisions for expanding the child tax credit and restoring some business tax breaks. The package must be brought to the Senate floor for a vote, regardless of who initiates the process or the outcome of the vote. It resolves as NO if such a package does not reach a floor vote by the specified date, for any reason. The identity of the Senate Majority Leader at the time of the potential vote is not relevant to the resolution of this question.

title: Will the NHTSA conclude its investigation into a high-profile autonomous vehicle fatal crash by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) officially concludes and publishes its findings from an investigation into a fatal crash involving a vehicle operating on an advanced driver assistance system. The investigation must specifically address a crash where such a vehicle hit and killed another road user. Resolution is based on official NHTSA statements or reports. If no conclusion is reached or published by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Tesla suspend its 'Full Self-Driving' system in the US by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tesla officially announces a suspension or discontinuation of its 'Full Self-Driving' system for consumer use in the United States. The suspension must be company-wide and apply to all Tesla vehicles equipped with the system. Resolution is based on official Tesla announcements, verified media reports from at least two reputable news sources, or regulatory filings. If no such suspension is announced or implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will US regulators mandate new safety requirements for automated driving systems by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a US federal regulatory body (such as NHTSA or the Department of Transportation) implements new, mandatory safety requirements specifically addressing automated driving systems like Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' mode. These requirements must be legally binding and apply to all manufacturers of such systems in the US. Resolution is based on official regulatory announcements or published rules in the Federal Register. If no such requirements are mandated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the USDA distribute at least $2 billion in aid to minority farmers by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) has distributed at least $2 billion in aid to Black and other minority farmers as part of a program to address past discrimination. The distribution must be officially reported by the USDA or at least two reputable news sources. If the total amount distributed is less than $2 billion by the resolution date, or if no such program is implemented or significantly altered to no longer meet this criteria, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will at least 23,000 minority farmers receive payments from the USDA discrimination settlement by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, official reports from the USDA or at least two credible news sources confirm that 23,000 or more Black and other minority farmers have received payments as part of the discrimination settlement announced by the Biden administration. The settlement aims to address decades of discrimination by the U.S. Department of Agriculture. If fewer than 23,000 farmers have received payments by the resolution date, or if the program is cancelled or significantly modified to reduce the number of recipients, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will there be a successful legal challenge to the USDA's minority farmer aid program by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling or official announcement confirms that a legal challenge has successfully halted, significantly altered, or overturned the USDA's $2 billion aid program for Black and other minority farmers announced by President Biden. The challenge must specifically target this program and result in a substantial change to its implementation or funding. If no such successful legal challenge occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.
